techmeme.title: Apple pulls the iPadOS 18 update for M4 iPad Pro models after bricking complaints as the company works "to resolve an issue impacting a small number of devices" (Juli Clover/MacRumors)
Intel's decision to delay new Germany and Poland plants by two years is a blow to the EU's goal of making 20% of the world's chips by 2030, up from ~9% in 2022 (Pieter Haeck/Politico)
Taiwanese chip industry suppliers have been expanding into the Japanese island of Kyushu, which has become a gateway for business growth after TSMC's arrival (Nikkei Asia)
BHP, the world's largest mining company by market cap, warns the rise of data centers and AI could exacerbate a looming shortage of copper by increasing demand (Leslie Hook/Financial Times)
CEO Anne Wojcicki says she remains committed to taking 23andMe private and is "surprised and disappointed" after all seven independent board directors resigned (Ashley Capoot/CNBC)
